display.title: Automated Input
description: Along with manual inputs, certain things can be observed to &&dmake mechanisms activate automatically&&r.

The &&eComparator&&r provides power based on &&dspecific information about the block it's facing&&r - like the fullness of &&3Containers&&r (0-15), &&3Beehives&&r (0-5), and &&3Cauldrons&&r (0-3), &&3Item Frame&&r rotation (1-8), and &&3Respawn Anchor&&r charge (0-15).

The &&eDaylight Detector&&r provides &&dpower during the daytime&&r, slowly transitioning at dusk and dawn. &&6Right-Click&&r a daylight detector to invert this, &&dproviding power at night&&r instead.

The &&eObserver&&r provides full power &&dwhenever the block it's facing changes&&r - breaking and placing, &&3Piston&&r movements, &&3Containers&&r opening, &&3Crops&&r growing, &&3Doors&&r opening, and much more.
The &&eSculk Sensor&&r provides power when it &&3senses vibrations&&r in an area - including all kinds of sounds.

The &&eCalibrated Sculk Sensor&&r has a 16 block (double) range. It only responds to sounds whose &&3frequency&&r &&dmatch its input power level&&r (0-15). Each type of sound has a frequency, such as movement (1), hurt sounds (7), item use (3), eating (8), or activating (10) and deactivating (9) blocks - Test it out!
